Description: Upper body sherd of Chian pottery type B kantharos with part of handle root; white slip; interior glazed black; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Kantharoi type B have painted inscriptions beneath the rim and several have been found on Aegina as well as at Naukratis (Williams 1983, 169). Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1857) (phase 2)
